item.title: CAS vs PRI Voice Channels
item.description: T1 telephone trunk lines are commonly used with PBX and IP PBX phone systems because most modern equipment can connect directly to them without a separate CSU/DSU box. There are two main types of T1 lines: CAS and PRI (also called ISDN PRI). The original T1 line design, T1 CAS, is divided into 24 channels, each carrying a 64 Kbps digitized phone call. This digital conversion process, known as PCM, ensures clear voice quality.

item.title: T1 Telephony Has Many Flavors
item.description: Initially designed for high-volume call transfer between telephone exchanges, T1 technology has evolved into a leading digital phone solution for businesses. If you’re considering T1, understanding the available options is crucial. T1 is a digital standard supporting voice, data, video, or a combination thereof. Originally, it carried 24 separate calls on individual channels called DS0s, collectively forming a T1 line or DS1. Each DS0 transmits digitized voice, call control, and signaling information.
